Requirements.Description: When the signature validation process is performed, then it MUST detect any modification of data.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C01 Implement Digital Signatures With Hash Chaining
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Digital signatures allows for external verification of log data tampering and
hash chaining allows for deleted log files to be detected.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure hash of data is included in digital signature.

Requirements.Description: When the signature validation process is performed, then it MUST detect any missing (deleted) log file.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C01 Implement Digital Signatures With Hash Chaining
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Digital signatures allows for external verification of log data tampering and
hash chaining allows for deleted log files to be detected.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure verification process includes a chained hash function.

Requirements.Description:
When a manual action is performed to generate each audit log type,
then the corresponding audit log type MUST be generated and recorded.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C02 Enable And Validate All Audit Log Types
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Review audit log configuration and ensure that all audit log types
are being generated and replicated to configured sinks
Attributes.Recommendation: Review audit log configuration

Requirements.Description: When an attempt is made to disable a log source, then an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C03 Alert On Audit Log Changes And Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that specific alerts have been configured to detect changes in
audit log configuration such as disabling exporting of logs.
Alerts MUST also be created to detect changes in retention/object lock policies
for exported data log sources/buckets.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure alerting is correctly configured

Requirements.Description:
When an attempt is made to alter the retention or object lock status
of an external data log source or bucket, then an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C03 Alert On Audit Log Changes And Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that specific alerts have been configured to detect changes in
audit log configuration such as disabling exporting of logs.
Alerts MUST also be created to detect changes in retention/object lock policies
for exported data log sources/buckets.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure alerting is correctly configured

Requirements.Description:
When audit log buckets are created then verify that server access
logging MUST be enabled for the audit log bucket,
with logs delivered to a separate, secure logging bucket.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C04 Ensure Access Logging Is Enabled on the Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that access logging is enabled for the audit log storage bucket to
capture all requests made to the bucket, providing an audit trail of data access.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Configure the audit log bucket to enable server access logging.
Ensure the target logging bucket is configured for appropriate security,
including restricted access and immutability.

Requirements.Description: When audit logs are exported, then audit logs MUST be present in the configured data location.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C05 Export Audit Logs To Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Configure audit logs to be sent to a external bucket where they can be globally replicated
and can be subject to greater access control and data retention polices.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure audit log exporting.

Requirements.Description:
When the retention policy is applied, then data MUST
be automatically deleted after the configured number of days.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C06 Enforce Retention Policy on Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Configure a custom retention policy on the designated audit log bucket to ensure that logs are
retained for the correct number of days as defined by your organization's policy.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Configure the audit log bucket's lifecycle rules or object retention settings to enforce
the required data retention period.

Requirements.Description:
When a standard file deletion is attempted on an object within
the audit log bucket, then it MUST be prevented unless MFA is provided.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C07 Enforce MFA Delete on Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) delete on the audit log bucket to
provide greater protection against accidental or malicious deletion of audit data.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Enable MFA Delete (or equivalent multi-factor authentication for delete operations)
on the audit log bucket.

Requirements.Description:
When an attempt is made to delete data before the object
lock period expires, then the deletion MUST be denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C08 Enable Object Lock On Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that object log is enabled globally on all objects with the bucket.
The lock time MUST be configured to meet your organization, legal and compliance goals.
Deletion attempts before the lock period MUST be denied.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure object lock policy.

Requirements.Description: When restricted fields are accessed by unauthorized users, then those fields MUST remain masked.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the confidentiality of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C09 Restrict Field And Log Type Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Configure access to audit logs to follow the principle of least privilege in particular where technically
possible limit the log fields users have access to to prevent accidental exposure to sensitive
information such as PII.
Attributes.Recommendation: Review field level access controls on audit data.

Requirements.Description:
When audit log storage bucket's are created then, bucket's access control settings MUST explicitly deny
public read and write access.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the confidentiality of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C10 Ensure Audit Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that audit log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent
unauthorized exposure of sensitive log data.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access.
Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Requirements.Description:
When the URL of a audit log storage bucket's object is accessed publicly then,
it should be denied by bucket policy.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the confidentiality of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.C10 Ensure Audit Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that audit log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent
unauthorized exposure of sensitive log data.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access.
Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Ensure that builds are executed only on authorized build agents to maintain
control over the build environment and prevent unauthorized code execution.

Attempt to trigger a build from an unauthorized external service or
repository and verify that the build does not start.

Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that builds can only be triggered by authorized external services or
repositories to prevent unauthorized code execution or tampering.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.Build.C03 Deny External Network Access for Build Environments
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that build environments do not have external network access to
prevent unauthorized external access and data exfiltration.

Requirements.Description:
Attempt to push an artifact with known vulnerabilities to the registry
and observe if it is flagged or rejected by the vulnerability scanning process.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CntrReg.C01 Implement Vulnerability Scanning for Artifacts
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that container images and artifacts stored in the container registry are scanned for
vulnerabilities to identify and remediate security issues before deployment.

Requirements.Description:
Confirm that artifacts older than the specified retention period are automatically
deleted from the registry.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CntrReg.C02 Implement Cleanup Policies for Artifacts
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that unused or outdated artifacts are cleaned up according to defined policies to
manage storage effectively and reduce security risks associated with outdated versions.

Requirements.Description:
Attempt to access underlying database tables directly without
using managed views and verify that access is denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.DataWar.C01 Enforce Use of Managed Views for Data Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that data access is provided through managed views, restricting users
from accessing underlying tables directly and enforcing consistent security policies.

Requirements.Description:
Attempt to query sensitive columns without the necessary permissions and
verify that access is denied or data is masked.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.DataWar.C02 Enforce Column-Level Security Policies
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that access to sensitive data columns is restricted based on user roles,
preventing unauthorized access to sensitive information.

Requirements.Description:
Attempt to query data rows that the user should not have access to and verify
that access is denied or data is not returned.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.DataWar.C03 Enforce Row-Level Security Policies
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that access to data rows is restricted based on user roles or attributes,
preventing unauthorized access to specific subsets of data.

MUST be validated before it is passed to a GenAI model.

When data is designated for model training or RAG ingestion, then its
source MUST be explicitly approved and its provenance documented.

When a RAG-enabled system generates a response containing information
retrieved from its knowledge base, then the response MUST include a
verifiable citation that links back to the specific source document.

availability, and sovereignty of data across its lifecycle.

Require the GenAI system to provide citations or direct links
back to the source documents used to generate a response, in
to enhance the transparency, trustworthiness, and verifiability
of AI-generated content.

Requirements.Description:
When an LLM invokes an external tool (e.g., an API, a plugin),
then the tool MUST operate with the least privileges required
for performing its intended functionality.

Attributes.FamilyDescription:
The Identity and Access Management control family ensures
that only trusted and authenticated entities can access
resources. These controls establish strong authentication,
enforce multi-factor verification, and restrict access to
approved sources to prevent unauthorized use or data exfiltration.
Attributes.Section: CCC.GenAI.C06 Least Privilege for Plugins
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Restricts the permissions of any external tools the GenAI system
can call to limit the potential damage if an agent is coerced
to perform unintended actions or vulnerabilities in the tools
are exploited.

Requirements.Description:
When an application makes an API call to a foundational model in a
production environment, then it MUST specify an explicit version
identifier.

Attributes.FamilyDescription:
The Configuration Management control family involves establishing,
maintaining and monitoring the configuration of the service and
related applications and infrastructure to ensure consistency,
secure defaults and compliance.
Attributes.Section: CCC.GenAI.C07 Model Version Pinning
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Mandate that applications are locked ("pinned") to a specific,
tested version of a foundational model to prevent unexpected
behaviour changes introduced by provider-side updates.

Requirements.Description:
When a new AI model is considered for production deployment, it
MUST undergo a formal red teaming and quality assurance review.

Attributes.FamilyDescription:
The Model Assurance and Evaluation control family encompasses
the proactiveand continuous processes of testing and validating
the AI model's behavior to ensure it aligns with safety, ethical,
and quality standards.
Attributes.Section: CCC.GenAI.C08 Quality Control and Red Teaming
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Establish a formal program for quality evaluation and adversarial
testing (red teaming) to ensure GenAI system meet all business,
quality, security and compliance requirements before getting deployed
into production environments.

Requirements.Description:
If model quality review or red teaming identifies an issue that exceeds
the organization's risk tolerance, the model MUST NOT be deployed until
the issue is remediated.

Requirements.Description:
When a key version is scheduled for deletion or disabled, an
alert MUST be generated within five minutes.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain key-management events.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.C01 Alert on Key-version Changes
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Generate near-real-time alerts when a KMS key version is disabled or scheduled for deletion, enabling rapid investigation and recovery.
Attributes.Recommendation: Use native event services (e.g., CloudWatch Events, Azure Monitor, Cloud Audit Logs) to route notifications to an incident-response channel.

Requirements.Description:
When IAM roles and key policies are reviewed, Decrypt permission
MUST be granted exclusively to documented authorised principals.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that enforce least-privilege use of KMS operations.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.C02 Limit Decrypt Permissions
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Restrict the Decrypt operation to authorised principals only, applying the principle of least privilege to protect sensitive data.
Attributes.Recommendation: Periodically audit policy documents via automated tooling and report any deviations.

Requirements.Description:
When rotation settings are examined, rotation MUST be enabled with
an interval not exceeding 365 days.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that govern creation, rotation, import, and retirement of cryptographic keys.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.C03 Enforce Automatic Rotation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure symmetric keys rotate automatically within policy intervals to reduce exposure of key material.
Attributes.Recommendation: Use cloud-provider rotation features and verify via configuration scanning.

Requirements.Description:
When a key import request is processed, the key MUST use an
approved algorithm (RSA-2048+, EC-P256+) and originate from a
certified HSM.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that govern creation, rotation, import, and retirement of cryptographic keys.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.C04 Validate Imported Keys
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Accept only externally generated keys that meet approved cryptographic strength and provenance requirements.
Attributes.Recommendation: Implement an approval workflow that validates attestation data before import.

Requirements.Description:
When a single client sends more than 2000 requests within any
5-minute sliding window, the load balancer MUST throttle all
subsequent requests from that client for at least 60 seconds.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that detect anomalous traffic and record load-balancer activity.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C01 Enforce and Detect Rate Limiting
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Detect and throttle malicious or excessive requests to prevent downstream resource exhaustion and brute-force activity.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Implement per-IP token-bucket limits with and verify via
synthetic traffic tests.

Requirements.Description:
When throttling is invoked, the load balancer MUST
record the event in the access log within 5 minutes
for alerting and trend analysis.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that detect anomalous traffic and record load-balancer activity.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C01 Enforce and Detect Rate Limiting
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Detect and throttle malicious or excessive requests to prevent downstream resource exhaustion and brute-force activity.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Enable access logging and configure metric filters
on HTTP 429 counts to trigger alerts.

Requirements.Description:
When more than 10 percent of targets change from healthy to
unhealthy within five minutes, an alert MUST be issued.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that detect anomalous traffic and record load-balancer activity.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C06 Secure Health-Check Telemetry
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Monitor health-check endpoints for tampering and alert on
abnormal status changes.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Instrument metrics for health check results and target
removal events. Configure monitoring alarms to alert
on abnormal spikes in unhealthy targets.

Requirements.Description:
When routing weights change, the request MUST originate
from an explicitly defined and trusted identity and MUST
be logged.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can change or query load-balancer resources.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C04 Enforce Distribution Policies
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure traffic-splitting weights and algorithms are modified
only by trusted identities.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Define a list of trusted principals allowed to modify
routing configurations. Enforce via conditional access
policies, and log changes using audit logging.

Requirements.Description:
When stickiness is enabled, session cookies MUST expire
within 30 minutes of inactivity.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can change or query load-balancer resources.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C05 Validate Session Affinity
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Configure session persistence to minimise fixation and hijacking
risks.
Attributes.Recommendation: Audit CCC.LB.F15 parameters via configuration scans.

Requirements.Description:
When an API call originates outside the approved CIDR
set, the request MUST be denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can change or query load-balancer resources.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C09 Restrict Management API Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Limit load-balancer API calls to authorised identities and
trusted networks.
Attributes.Recommendation: Combine VPC endpoints with IAM condition-key filters for protected APIs.

Requirements.Description:
When concurrent connections reach 80 percent of capacity, the
autoscaling group MUST add at least one instance within five
minutes.

Attributes.FamilyDescription:
Controls that preserve availability and confidentiality of
traffic processed by the load balancer.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C02 Auto-Scale Load Balancer Capacity
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Expand load-balancer capacity to maintain availability during traffic
spikes.
Attributes.Recommendation: Enable autoscaling policies.

Requirements.Description:
When responses pass through the load balancer, the
"Server" header MUST be replaced with "lb".

Attributes.FamilyDescription:
Controls that preserve availability and confidentiality of
traffic processed by the load balancer.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C07 Scrub Sensitive Headers
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Remove headers that disclose internal details or software
versions from HTTP responses.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure header-transformation rules.

Requirements.Description:
When a certificate is within 30 days of expiry, automated renewal
MUST complete and deploy a new certificate within 24 hours.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that ensure trustworthy TLS certificates and ciphers.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.C08 Automate Certificate Renewal
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Maintain valid TLS certificates by automating renewal and
deployment before expiry.
Attributes.Recommendation: Use certificate-manager auto-renewal workflows.

Requirements.Description:
When a new cloud account is created, provider-level audit and network flow logging MUST be
enabled by default and directed to the central sink.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C01 Centralized and Comprehensive Log Aggregation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure all operational and security logs from across the cloud environment, including
applications, operating systems, network traffic, and cloud service activity, are captured
automatically and streamed to a central, secure log management service.

Requirements.Description:
When a new cloud compute resource is deployed, it MUST be configured to forward all relevant
logs (e.g., OS, application, service logs) to the central log sink.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C01 Centralized and Comprehensive Log Aggregation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure all operational and security logs from across the cloud environment, including
applications, operating systems, network traffic, and cloud service activity, are captured
automatically and streamed to a central, secure log management service.

Requirements.Description:
When a new log bucket or stream is created, its retention policy MUST be configured
in accordance with organisation's data retention policy.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C02 Enforce Data Retention Policy for Logs
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that the retention period configured for logs aligns with the organization's
data retention policy.

Requirements.Description:
When a query is performed to retrieve log events older than the number of days defined
in the organisation's data retention policy, it MUST return an empty result.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C02 Enforce Data Retention Policy for Logs
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that the retention period configured for logs aligns with the organization's
data retention policy.

Requirements.Description:
When an attempt is made to modify or delete data before the object
lock period expires, then the action MUST be denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C03 Enable Object Lock On Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure log immutability by enabling Write Once, Read Many (WORM) protection
using object lock on log storage buckets. This prevents logs from being modified
or deleted during the defined retention period, supporting compliance and forensic
integrity.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure object lock policy.

Requirements.Description: When restricted fields are accessed by unauthorized users, then those fields MUST remain masked.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can access and modify logs.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C04 Restrict Field And Log Type Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Configure access to logs to follow the principle of least privilege in particular where technically
possible limit the log fields users have access to to prevent accidental exposure to sensitive
information such as PII.
Attributes.Recommendation: Review field level access controls on log data.

Requirements.Description:
When a log storage bucket is created, the bucket's access control settings MUST
explicitly deny public read and write access.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can access and modify logs.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C05 Ensure Log Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized
access to sensitive log data. In addition, logs should be replicated to another cloud
region to enhance availability, durability, and support disaster recovery requirements.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access.
Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Requirements.Description:
When the URL of a log storage bucket's object is accessed publicly, the action MUST be denied
by bucket policy.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can access and modify logs.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C05 Ensure Log Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Ensure that log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized
access to sensitive log data. In addition, logs should be replicated to another cloud
region to enhance availability, durability, and support disaster recovery requirements.
Attributes.Recommendation:
Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access.
Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Requirements.Description:
When a single principal executes an anomalously high number of log queries,
an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain logging-related events.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C06 Detect and Alert on Potential Log Exfiltration
Attributes.SubSectionObjective:
Identify and alert on anomalous data access patterns that may indicate an attempt
to exfiltrate log data.

Requirements.Description:
When an audit log event is recorded that corresponds to a modification of the logging service
configuration such as disabling a log trail, deleting a log sink, or altering a log forwarding rule,
an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain logging-related events.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.C07 Detect and Alert on Log Service Tampering
